name: post_files_id_upload_sessions
description: Creates an upload session for an existing file.

file_id.description:
The unique identifier that represents a file.

The ID for any file can be determined
by visiting a file in the web application
and copying the ID from the URL. For example,
for the URL `https://*.app.box.com/files/123`
the `file_id` is `123`.

file_name.description: The optional new name of new file

file_size.description: The total number of bytes of the file to be uploaded

$block: An upload session for chunk uploading a file.

$ul: **id**: The unique identifier for this session
**num_parts_processed**: The number of parts that have been uploaded and processed
**part_size**: The  size in bytes that must be used for all parts of of the
**session_endpoints**
**session_expires_at**: The date and time when this session expires.
**total_parts**: The total number of parts expected in this upload session,
**type**: `upload_session`
**code**: A Box-specific error code
**context_info**: A free-form object that contains additional context
**message**: More details on the error.
**help_url**: A URL that links to more information about why this error occurred.
**message**: A short message describing the error.
**request_id**: A unique identifier for this response, which can be used
**status**: The HTTP status of the response.
**type**: `error`
